unauth.info: Lexica is still under development. Features may change over time.

one.title: What is Lexica?
one.content: Lexica is a tool to find new ways to edit lexicographical data on Wikidata. Here, Lexica provides an editing view for lexicographical data on Wikidata to make quick contributions easier. You will be given Lexemes that need to be connected to Items on Wikidata.

two.title: How to use
two.point1Content: end your contribution session and return to the Homepage.
two.point2Content: displays the sequence of the cards currently shown.
two.point3Content: swipe up on the card’s header to skip the current card.
two.point4Content: use this button as another way to skip a card.
two.point5Content: end your contribution session and return to the Homepage.

three.title: Anatomy of a contribution card
three.point1Content: includes the Lemma, Lexeme ID, definition of the Lexeme, and button to view additional information about the Lexeme.
three.point2Content: includes question, search box, and Item or search results.
three.point3Content: select “Next” after choosing the correct Item or select “Item not found” if you do not find any.

four.title: All done!
four.content1: Happy contributing to lexicographical data on Wikidata with Lexica!
four.content2: Tip: You can view this tutorial again from the Homepage.

noInternet.title: Unable to upload contribution
noInternet.description: Check your internet connection, then try again.

main.emptyLoad: You’ve reached the end of search results

cardError.title: Upload failed
cardError.description: Check your internet connection and try again.

done.title: Thank you for contributing with Lexica!

blank.title: There are no cards that can be filled in again at the moment.

about.title: About
about.content1: Editing lexicographical data on Wikidata through mobile devices can be challenging for some. That is why {lexica} was created. Our goal is straightforward: to make editing simpler and accessible for everyone, everywhere.
about.content2: {lexica} is an innovative tool crafted to empower you to seamlessly contribute to the lexicographical data on Wikidata. As a web-based tool optimized for mobile devices, {lexica} allows you to quickly connect Lexeme Senses to Items on Wikidata through an intuitive card interface.
about.content3: {lexica} is being developed by Indonesian software developers in collaboration with Wikimedia Deutschland, as part of the Wikidata Software Collaboration, supported by a grant from the Arcadia Philanthropic Fund.
about.content4: We are committed to continuously developing {lexica} to enhance the user experience. To learn more about our project, please visit {link}.

privacy.section1: Lexica is still in the early stages of development. The privacy policy will be continuously updated along with changes to Lexica. By using Lexica, users are considered to agree to this privacy policy.

section2.point1: Lexica does not store any data associated with users, such as but no means limited to usernames, passwords, IP addresses, interaction history, and usage statistics.
section2.point2: Lexica only obtains authorization to take actions on behalf of users when users log in through their Wikimedia user account.
section2.point3: User contribution records will be stored on Wikidata, which is subject to the {privacy}

section4.point1: Lexica may change its privacy policy at any time.
section4.point2: Before making changes to the privacy policy, Lexica will provide prior notification regarding the changes to the privacy policy before they are permanently implemented.
section4.point3: Notifications of changes to the privacy policy will be announced through Lexica.
section4.point4: There is a period of time referred to as “waiting period”, which covers seven days following the announcement of the privacy policy change and the implementation of the new privacy policy.
section4.point5: Lexica recommends users to regularly check for changes to the privacy policy that can be found on this page, the user page on Wikidata, and the Wikimedia Foundation privacy policy.
section4.point6: By continuing to use Lexica after the privacy policy changes, the user agrees to the revised privacy policy change.

section1.content1: {lexica} and all its components are published under the {gnu} (GNU GPL-2.0) license. All data added with this tool will be stored on Wikidata under the {cc0} (CC0) license.
section1.content2: The source code for Lexica is available in the following repositories:
